TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ImageIndexConverter extends System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert data for an image index to and from a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ImageIndexConverter class is used to convert index values of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> to and from other data types, typically <xref:System.String>. For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an ImageIndexConverter. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes and instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified value object to a 32-bit signed integer object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This type converter only can convert a 32-bit signed integer object to and from a string.
The `context` can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This may be `null`, so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return `null`.

Docs.exception: The conversion could not be performed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertTo (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, Type destinationType);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertTo(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value, class System.Type destinationType) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
The object to convert, typically an index represented as an <xref:System.Int32>.
The type to convert the object to, often a <xref:System.String>.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to the specified destination type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation of this method can only convert an index value represented as an <xref:System.Int32> to a <xref:System.String>.

Docs.exception: The specified could not be converted to the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter/StandardValuesCollection GetStandardValues(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of standard index values for the image list associated with the specified format context.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> that holds a standard set of valid index values. If no image list is found, this collection will contain a single object with a value of -1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Returns a collection of index values for image lists associated with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext.Instance%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the `context` parameter. If an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> is not found, then the parent of the component will be searched for such a list.
Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method is called to before an attempt is made to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesExclusive(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines if the list of standard values returned from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is an exclusive list.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method returns an exclusive list of valid values; otherwise, . This implementation always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the list returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is exclusive, then no other values are valid. This is typical of an enumerated data type. If the list is not exclusive, then there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
As implemented in this type converter, this method always returns `false`.
Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method is called to before an attempt is made to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesSupported(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from. This parameter or properties of this parameter can be .
Docs.summary: Determines if the type converter supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method returns a standard set of values; otherwise, . Always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks As implemented in this class, GetStandardValuesSupported always returns `true` since this object supports a standard set of index values for images that can be picked from a list.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a or value is valid in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> collection.
Docs.value: if a or value is valid in the standard values collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks As implemented in this class is always returns `true`.
